sections.1_story: Imagine you are filling a water tank or wrapping a gift box. You need to know the volume to fill the tank and the surface area to wrap the box. Mensuration 3D helps you calculate volumes and surface areas of solid shapes, which is essential in exams and real-life applications.

ğŸ’¡ Volume: The amount of space occupied by a solid.
ğŸ’¡ Surface Area: The total area of all faces of a solid.
ğŸ’¡ Lateral Surface Area (LSA): Area of all faces except the base(s).
ğŸ’¡ Total Surface Area (TSA): Area of all faces including base(s).
ğŸ’¡ Height: The perpendicular distance from base to top.
ğŸ’¡ Radius: Distance from center to boundary in a sphere/cylinder/cone.
ğŸ’¡ Slant Height: The diagonal height of a cone or pyramid.
ğŸ’¡ Base Area: Area of the bottom face.

5_exam_examples.answer: Volume: 120 cu cm, TSA: 158 sq cm
